comments.body: Why it was necessary to regress here?

While it needs includes for dictionary generation - see code.
It was failing on some platforms when I was testing my other PR
So, some of the dictionaries that failed missed a dependency to pythia8?

It is a way how current dictionary generation works.
It able to extract includes which are configured via `target_include_directories`. 
After my bigger PR it will not be a case - one needs to use `include_directories` to set includes for dictionary. So to say - this change is preparation for next PR

> After my bigger PR it will not be a case - one needs to use include_directories to set includes for dictionary.

Can you then remove it from this PR, please? We'll discuss the requirement of using `include_directories` in the other PR.

Currently `include_directories` and `target_include_directories` are equivalent for dictionary generation - they leads to same arguments for `cling`. In my mind, using `include_directories` express more clearly that includes required for the cling

> In my mind, using include_directories express more clearly that includes required for the cling

That's something we should probably be discussing in the other PR? For starters, check the arguments provided here: https://pspdfkit.com/blog/2018/modern-cmake-tips/

But `target_include_directories` does not work for dictionary target. Command we produce for the `rootcling` can not be adjusted via `target_include_directories(G__Something PRIVATE ${CUSTOM_INCLUDE_PATH})`. And `include_directories` is simple alternative - especially while our cmake files split on many subprojects
`include_directories` is 'global' state which may break encapsulation. I'd prefer not to make this particular change as part of this PR and deal with rootcling elsewhere.
It is global until end of current cmake file, it is not extend to other targets in other cmake files
